import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Layout, Navigation, Content } from 'react-mdl'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import PostiLock from './images/PostiLock.jpg'; import PostiAll from './images/PostiAll.jpg'; import PS1 from './images/PS1.png'; import PS2 from './images/PS2.png'; import PS3 from './images/PS3.png'; import PS4 from './images/PS4.png'; class Resume extends Component { render() { return(

Posti

(2019 , Helsinki.)

"Project collaboration between Aalto University and Posti to revolutionize the e-commerce segment."

During six month my team "The orange tree" with the collaboration of two members of the company Vincit, develop a new service for Posti. It was a project collaboration between Aalto University and Posti, the leading post company from Finland. The main objective of the team was to create and develop a new service that helps the company to lead the innovation in the e-commerce sector.

The team was challenged to develop the new service with the only limitation that technology has to ve involved in the final solution. Then, the team was able to present any crazy idea that improves Posti service. With all this into account, the team started to work to bring up a new revolutionary service but to be able to do that we should go thought some steps.

The problem

The project intended to teach the overall process and practices of user-centred design of digital products and services. Therefore, we needed to start designing them from scratch going through all the stages of the procedure.

  1. Identifying and validating topics: On this stage of the process, we conducted 10 semi-structured interviews to get insights from some current users of Posti services.
  2. Ideation session: After gathering all the data on the previous step, we started creating ideas which could be related to the previous insights. The method used was 6-3-5 Brainwriting combined with the method of Rubber ducking; the purpose of this method was to generate free and spontaneously ideas without criticism. The total number of generated ideas was 109.
  3. Select 10 concepts: After filtering the ideas and removing those which were repeated, we conducted Qualitative Pros and Cons and 7 dots voting methods. Through these methods, we could easily filter the concepts by using the votes of the team members to get TOP 10.
  4. After reviewing the TOP 10 we decided to drop 6 more and to continue with those which we considered potentially above average.
  5. Once selected the TOP 4 we developed a way to visualize each of them. In the end, we finally concluded with our final concept: The modular box, called "Triit"
  6. The last step of the process would be to prototype not only the required software of the product but also the modular box to visualize the final product.

Result

After going thought all this step, the result that The orange tree bring was "Triit". Triit is a detachable smart box, giving the option to the users can move from the locker to their homes. The service was created to bring more freedom to the user of Posti, allowing them to control 27/7 the parcel from the app and choose where and how they take the receive. The application also offers the user to make their purchase from the Posti platform. This guarantee a faster and easier service for the customer and company. To make the experience more pleasant for the customer, they were able to make their purchase with swiping gestures. Finally, the other main goal of the modular box was to reduce the consume ob cardboard boxes, reducing the waste of plastic and paper.

My role

My main motivation for this project came from my previous bad experience waiting to receive a parcel. During this project, I find out that I was not the only one having this kind of problems. A lot of Posti costumers complain of the lack of information, the box was damaged, or the parcel ends up on one of the Posti offices. That is why, when we started brainstorming looking for new services, I proposed an alternative option based on the concept of bringing a service that let the customers control the parcel 24/7. The idea was welcomed by the team, and after considering the rest of our proposed concepts, we decided to continue with this one.

As a team member, I participated in all the process mentioned previously and play my role as a UX/UI designer. From all my work I feel proud that the team decided to choose one of my ideas and my role in the design of the box, and the concept of the application. Also, I am very happy with the final result of my presentation of the ten final concepts; in front of all the student, the teachers, and the Posti employees.

Mocks

The software used on this project to accomplish the task of prototyping was Sketch. After iterating along the process by testing the mockup and polishing it, we ended up with the following prototype:
